Crimes.Legal_Issue: Extension of time to object to Notice of Ascertained Forfeiture
Crimes.Evidence_Assessment: Lawyer's computational error leading to two-day delay
Crimes.Burden_of_Proof: Applicant must show bona fide intention and that it is just and equitable
Crimes.Credibility_Factor: Prompt action by Mr. Heron after missing deadline
Crimes.Legal_Rule: s. 129.2 allows extension if applied within one year, bona fide intent, and just and equitable
Crimes.Grounds_for_Claim: Bona fide intention to object and minor unintentional delay
Crimes.Outcome_on_Merits: Objection deemed timely upon court order
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: No prejudice to Minister; fairness upheld
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Considered: Timing of application, reason for delay, lack of prejudice
Crimes.Applicant_Challenge: Overcoming denial of extension by Minister
Crimes.Defendant_Response: Not opposed on grounds of prejudice
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Affidavit or sworn statement regarding intent and timeline
Crimes.Remedy_Requested: Extension of time to file objection
Crimes.Authority: Minister of Public Safety and Federal Court
